intro: Galium pumilum subsp. tenue, commonly known as slender wood-sorrel, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of temperate and subtropical regions.
